docs.snippet: Australia coach Ange Postecoglou has omitted long-serving captain Lucas Neill and a clutch of seasoned players from a 23-man squad for a World Cup warmup against Ecuador, underlining his intent to inject some new blood into the team....
docs.lead_paragraph: Australia coach Ange Postecoglou has omitted long-serving captain Lucas Neill and a clutch of seasoned players from a 23-man squad for a World Cup warmup against Ecuador, underlining his intent to inject some new blood into the team.

headline.main: Australia Dump Neill for World Cup Warmup

docs.snippet: SCHWARTZ--Barry Frederick, the former President of Doe-Spun, Chairman of the Lawrence Village Park Commission, and President of the Bristol Plaza (200/210 East 65th Street) died on Saturday at the Memorial Sloan-Kettering Hospital in New York City...
docs.lead_paragraph: SCHWARTZ--Barry Frederick, the former President of Doe-Spun, Chairman of the Lawrence Village Park Commission, and President of the Bristol Plaza (200/210 East 65th Street) died on Saturday at the Memorial Sloan-Kettering Hospital in New York City. He was 74 years old. Mr. Schwartz was a visionary leader in the children's apparel industry. Doe-Spun's licensed children's clothing brands included Nautica, Diane von Furstenberg, Colorforms, Absorba, Barney the Dinosaur, Budgie the Helicopter, Thomas the Tank Engine, and Might Morphin Power Rangers. His longstanding support of Jewish communities around the world earned him the United Jewish Appeal's Children's Apparel Division Man of the Year. His work for disadvantaged children around the world culminated in his becoming a founding member of the board of K.I.D.S. (Kids in Distressed Situations). He was an ardent support of the Joel Finkelstein Cancer Foundation among many additional philanthropic activities. Mr. Schwartz was a former "all star" quarterback who was recruited to play collegiate football both by Southern Illinois University and by Georgia Tech. Mr. Schwartz is survived by his wife, Elaine, and children Jodi and Andrew Sussman, and Daniel Schwartz, grandchildren Ben and Carly Sussman, and sister Roberta Schwartz. Donations in Mr. Schwartz's honor may be sent to the Jewish Communal Fund/Barry F. Schwartz Memorial Fund (575 Madison Avenue, Suite 703, New York, NY 10022).

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SCHWARTZ, BARRY F.

docs.snippet: Britain's second-biggest bookmaker, Ladbrokes, said operating profit would take a hit in the first half of 2014 due to upgrades to its online service, as it ended another troubled year with a sharp fall in annual profit....
docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's second-biggest bookmaker, Ladbrokes, said operating profit would take a hit in the first half of 2014 due to upgrades to its online service, as it ended another troubled year with a sharp fall in annual profit.

headline.main: Ladbrokes Sees More Pain Before Gain From Online Upgrade
headline.print_headline: Ladbrokes Sees More Pain Before Gain From Online Upgrade
